title: Unexpectedly high GC constantly 10-20 seconds behind.
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.48.1-stable-674b77f0`

OS & Version: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS 

Drive type: NVME SSD SPCC M.2 PCIe SSD

Commit hash: 

Erigon Command (with flags/config): erigon --datadir="/data/erigon/datadir" --snap.stop --authrpc.jwtsecret="/data/erigon/jwtsecret" --batchSize=10MB --db.pagesize=64kb --pprof --torrent.download.slots=30 --torrent.download.rate=800mb --http --http.addr="0.0.0.0" --http.port="8545" --http.api="txpool,eth,admin,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon" --ws --internalcl --graphql

Concensus Layer: internalcl

Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
After finishing the sync my GC was around 1% and slowly reducing but due to a power failure my server was down for 1-2 hours. After coming online the GC is at 3.1%. Is there any way to reduce this faster? At this rate it will take over 30 days to go down.

#### Actual behaviour
```[INFO] [09-17|12:20:01.685] Timings (slower than 50ms)               Headers=274ms CallTraces=107ms AccountHistoryIndex=72ms StorageHistoryIndex=108ms LogIndex=84ms TxLookup=80ms
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:01.685] Tables                                   PlainState=99.4GB AccountChangeSet=149.1GB StorageChangeSet=272.8GB BlockTransaction=168.5GB TransactionLog=567.9GB FreeList=7.4MB ReclaimableSpace=119.0GB
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:01.793] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:09.256] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth67=1 eth68=10
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.203] [2/15 Headers] Handling new payload      height=18157181 hash=0x983fe3cde7ee775d90c69fc109239eac2a2b94c87cff154b2ef7e91c9aa6d702
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.352] [5/7 Execution] Completed on             block=18157181
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.726] Timings (slower than 50ms)               Headers=10.931s
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.726] Tables                                   PlainState=99.4GB AccountChangeSet=149.1GB StorageChangeSet=272.8GB BlockTransaction=168.5GB TransactionLog=567.9GB FreeList=7.4MB ReclaimableSpace=118.0GB
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.726] [2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer... 
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.738] [txpool] stat                            pending=125 baseFee=38 queued=4 alloc=5.6GB sys=6.3GB
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:12.771] [2/15 Headers] Fork choice update: flushing in-memory state (built by previous newPayload) 
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:13.755] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=18157180 to=18157181 hash=0x983fe3cde7ee775d90c69fc109239eac2a2b94c87cff154b2ef7e91c9aa6d702 header sending=13.52Âµs log sending=230ns
[INFO] [09-17|12:20:13.755] Timings (slower than 50ms)               Headers=340ms CallTraces=106ms AccountHistoryIndex=75ms StorageHistoryIndex=139ms LogIndex=136ms TxLookup=81ms```

Mdbxâs GC % - itâs free pages amount. Itâs not âtimeâ. And itâs not much related to sync speed.
Sorry about that, my understanding of it came from other similar issues. So how would I resolve constantly being behind 10+ seconds?
